p: In 2012, another collection of dimeric and oligomeric resveratrol derivatives ( Fig. 19 ), previously isolated from plants of Hopea genus, was screened as anti-HSV-1 and anti-HSV-2 agents by Chen. et al. [ 103]. In general, the compounds were more active against HSV-2 infection than that from HSV-1. Vaticaffinol, a tetramer with reported antifungal properties, was one of the most promising compounds, with an IC 50 value of 3.2 μM against HSV-2. The results of this study showed a potent, dose-dependent antiviral effect of the compounds, which promoted ROS production, coinciding with suppression of HSV-1 and HSV-2 replication in treated cells [ 103].
